channel.title: Billpay Ticketsystem
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [IPL-19329] [INV-PL] Gläubiger-ID is missing for PM 5
item.description:
This is a urgent hot fix Prio 1

Gläubiger-ID is missing for PM 5.(For PM 6 it is working, maybe because it's already NET.M ownership?)
Therefore the XML got rejected by the banks.

Assign "do_creditor_identifier" = "DE19ZZZ00000237180" (BillPay) to debt.

See example: https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=25795857
in bvwsdd-0006500412-20150126050434-0ex.xml

<DrctDbtTx>
 
					<MndtRltdInf>
 
						<MndtId>6268869-0-9552635</MndtId>
 
						<DtOfSgntr>2014-11-17</DtOfSgntr>
 
						<AmdmntInd>false</AmdmntInd>
 
					</MndtRltdInf>
 
					<CdtrSchmeId>
 
						<Id>
 
							<PrvtId>
 
								<Othr>
 
									<Id/>
 
									<SchmeNm>
 
										<Prtry>SEPA</Prtry>
 
									</SchmeNm>
 
								</Othr>
 
							</PrvtId>
 
						</Id>
 
					</CdtrSchmeId>
 
				</DrctDbtTx>
 
				<DbtrAgt>
 
					<FinInstnId>
 
						<BIC>WELADE3LXXX</BIC>
 
					</FinInstnId>
 
				</DbtrAgt>
 
				<Dbtr>
 
					<Nm>Tina Pettersson</Nm>
 
				</Dbtr>
 
				<DbtrAcct>
 
					<Id>
 
						<IBAN>DE43476501300135365971</IBAN>
 
					</Id>
 
				</DbtrAcct>
 
				<RmtInf>
 
					<Ustrd>SEPATCDD000007805625 mysportworld.de S30414997 SERVICEGEBUEHR IHRE BILLPAYZAHLUNG 0049 30 609 893 555 WWW.BILLPAY.DE</Ustrd>
 
				</RmtInf>
 
			</DrctDbtTxInf>
item.summary: [INV-PL] Gläubiger-ID is missing for PM 5

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
problem is that for that debt the associated mandate to the debt has debt_owner_id = 0:
Mandate entry:
"1720248";6268869;9552635;0;"6268869-0-9552635";0;1;"2015-01-24 20:44:49.709615";"";"";"";""

Bug is that in the conversion we were doing:

					CASE l_payment_method
 
					WHEN 5 THEN 0
 
					ELSE 1 END,

where:

0;"NA";"''"
 
1;"Billpay";"DE19ZZZ00000237180"
 
2;"BVW";"DE62ZZZ00000009232"

So the fix was:

CASE l_payment_method
 
				WHEN 5 THEN 1
 
				ELSE 2 END;

Fixed on live db

item.title: [IPL-18787] [DEARM] Lettershop Bugs
item.description:
Introduction

Our DEARM lettershop Template has some bugs.

Responsible PO Responsible PM Responsible RM
Stefan James Duc Arne
Description
  • the following example is, but you have to check all 15 DEARM templates:
  • DEARM
  • payment method 2
  • dunning 2
  • medium
  • you can refer to this ticket for the conditions and how the lines should look like IPL-17064
    1 These should be dotted lines
    2 This line's font size is way too large and the text is cut off at the end (Berlin)
    3 Same as in 1. dotted lines
    4 Which parameter is used for this date?
    Additionally, the space between "11" and "12" is bigger then "12" and "2014". It looks strange on paper. ignore, if it's font related
    5 There should be a condition here. IF value is equal or smaller than "0", THEN do not show this part.
    Also the parameter returns "0.0" when everywhere else we use "93,00" (komma instead of dot).
    6 Same condition as in 5.
    7 "While you are at it, please remove Christine Kiefer from the footer.
    (will this also affect the other DEARM letters? Would be good)"

General Bugs

Acceptance Criteria
  • please check the other DEARM templates aswell (should be 15 tempaltes in total to be checked)
  • must be reviewed by Arne or Duc
TODO
item.summary: [DEARM] Lettershop Bugs

status.description: Issue is pending / todo

comments.comment: dot and wrong date ist fixed. Displaying 0€ not.

item.title: [IPL-19260] [DEARM] No DEARM for cancelled direct debit orders
item.description:
In US IPL-16793 we "accidentally" specified for "customer_debt_status" = 3 (CANCELLED) to "dsc_dd_debt_elligible_for_dearm" = true which is wrong
(No DEARM for cancelled debts)

See also: https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=26435847

We should set

For customer_debt_status = 3 (CANCELLED) dsc_dd_debt_elligible_for_dearm = false

TODO:

1. Change flag to false (CANCELLED state)
2. Find out how many debts are affected and fix them (manually) (list them here)
3. Double check that setting the flag to true will ultimately not invoke the DEARM for returning DD for cancelled orders
4. Test

This should be an hotfix
item.summary: [DEARM] No DEARM for cancelled direct debit orders

status.description: Issue is pending / todo

item.title: [IPL-19108] [MDD] [CP] [PM1] [PM2] Implement filter for move due date options
item.description:
Introduction

Because there can be some cases where the customer moves his due date in CP and after the move he is still in eg. dunning state (bad customer experience), so we want to be more restrictive with the move due date options. (Options= 5,30,60 days)
Because we don't want to touch the REST response now. We implement some logic in the CP depending on the customer debt staus. This applies for PM 1 & 2.

Responsible PO Responsible PM
Stefan Duc
Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Almost no restrcition depending the move due date option in the CP if move due date is allowed Depending on the customer debt state we disallow certain move due date options

This logic is additional (and more restrictive) than just the move due date allowed flag which we receive in the open orders REST response.

Implement logic to allow move due date options for PM 1

IF PM = 1 (INVOICE)
 
IF "d_customer_debt_status" = 12 (DUNNING 1) THEN NOT allow 5 day move -- allow only 30 & 60 days move 
IF "d_customer_debt_status" = 13 (DUNNING 2) THEN NOT allow 5 & 30  day move -- allow only  60 days move

Implement logic to allow move due date options for PM 2

IF PM = 2 (DIECT DEBIT)
 
IF "d_customer_debt_status" = 12 or 13 (DUNNING 1 or DUNNING 2) THEN NOT allow 5 day move -- allow only 30 & 60 days move

Note: Change billing date for PM 3,4,5,6 stay untouched.

TODO
  • Implement logic to allow move due date options for PM 1
  • Implement logic to allow move due date options for PM 2
  • manually test
  • create UI test?
item.summary: [MDD] [CP] [PM1] [PM2] Implement filter for move due date options

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [IPL-19125] ES - Create the encryption service
item.description:
The encryption service in the web application will have the following interface:

Decrypt

Create 2 new functions:
public File decryptFile(File data, FetchKeyDTO[] decryptionColumns, int[] targetColumns)
private String[] decryptColumn(String[] data, FetchKeyDTO decryptionColumn)

The datatype will need to be String[] and NOT Byte[][]. This is because users of the web application will need to upload csv files with the encrypted values embedded.
The way they will copy out of the database is:

SELECT encode(cba_account_number_encrypted, 'hex')
 
FROM ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account
 
WHERE cba_id = 1;

This will result in a hex encoded String which can be easily copy pasted and viewable when opening a csv in Windows and Linux

decryptFile

First the decryptFile function will turn the data File into a String[][].
On error log the request (decryptionColumns and targetColumns) and the error
On success log the request (decryptionColumns, targetColumns and the first x rows of data)
Then loop

LOOP i from 1 to size(targetcolumns)
 
int targetColumn = targetcolumns[i];
 
FetchKeyDTO decryptionColumn = decryptionColumns[i];
 
data[targetColumn] = decryptColumn(data[targetColumn], decryptionColumn);

decryptColumn

First the decryptColumn function will fetch the key from the key database (or EncryptionKeyProvider)
then they will loop over the array of input strings calling
EncryptionServiceAbstract.java->decrypt(byte[] encryptedValue, String key)
for each string to decrypt. They will need to decode from hex to byte[] for decrypt

Encrypt is also required. FOr example inserting bank account whitelist by Christian

IN) roleName : String, rolePassword : String, keyDatabase : String, keySchema : String, keyTable : String, keyColumn : String, plainTextColumnContents : String[]
OUT) encryptedColumnContents : String[]
item.summary: ES - Create the encryption service

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [IPL-19155] ES - Create frontend to call the encryption Service
item.description:
Make something simple like service/test.jsp
Label1: "upload file:"
button1: "browse" (selects the file)
Label2: "Role name"
Field1: (linked to role name)
Label3: "Role password"
Field2: (linked to role password and typical **** mode)

Dynamic list (can add or remove rows) where each row looks like:
Database: _____ Schema: _____ Table: _____ Column: _____ Index: _____

Finally a submit button.

The submit button would take the file, the role info and the list of columns to call
public File decryptFile(File data, FetchKeyDTO[] decryptionColumns, int[] targetColumns)
in the encryption service

Then the new file will be sent to the user.

The application should use secure connections only
item.summary: ES - Create frontend to call the encryption Service

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [IPL-19126] ES - Clean up EncryptionServiceAbstract
item.description:
Remove:
DatabaseDecryptionService.java
DatabaseEncryptionService.java
EncryptionServiceAbstract.java->decrypt(String armorEncryptedValue, String roleName, String columnName)

As these are no longer used.

The rest of this ticket applies to EncryptionServiceAbstract.java

Create:
String decrypt(byte[] encryptedValue, String key)
Byte[] encrypt(String clearValue, String key)
They will look something like:

            if (StringUtils.isNotBlank(encryptionKey)) {
 
                try {
 
        			SecretKey keySpec = new SecretKeySpec(CryptoUtils.getMD5DigestBytes(encryptionKey), "AES");
 
        			Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES");
 
        			cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, keySpec);
 
        			decryptedResultValue = new String(cipher.doFinal(encryptedValue));
 
 
 
                } catch (DatabaseSecurityException e) {
 
                    LOG.error("Decrypting error.", e);
 
                } catch (IllegalBlockSizeException e) {
 
					e.printStackTrace();
 
				} catch (BadPaddingException e) {
 
					e.printStackTrace();
 
				} catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) {
 
					e.printStackTrace();
 
				} catch (NoSuchPaddingException e) {
 
					e.printStackTrace();
 
				} catch (InvalidKeyException e) {
 
					e.printStackTrace();
 
				}
 
            } else {
 
                LOG.error("Decrypting error, no encryption key found!");
 
            }

Refactor:
decrypt(byte[] encryptedValue, String roleName, String columnName)
encrypt(String clearValue, String roleName, String columnName)
to call the new functions decrypt(byte[] encryptedValue, String key) and encrypt(String clearValue, String key)
item.summary: ES - Clean up EncryptionServiceAbstract

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [IPL-19167] DB - Migration scripts (drop/rename/etc)
item.description:
We will actually not be dropping/renaming the column as we will keep the old column as a fail safe.

Whenever the encryption fails a java application should be inserting the plain text in the old column and later this value will be encrypted and saved in the encrypted column. (This should be handled in the part 2 user story)

Consider what will happen to DWH when something fails, the plain text is inserted, and then DWH pulls the null values from the encrypted column

What we will do for safety is make a script that copies the current column to a new column and deletes all values where the encrypted version is not null. Psedocode will be something like:

update  ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account set cba_account_number_encrypted = <<FIND PROPER PGCRYPTO ENCRYPTION>>cba_account_number
 
WHERE cba_account_number_encrypted is null;
 
alter table ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account add column cba_account_number_backup;
 
update  ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account set cba_account_number_backup = cba_account_number;
 
update  ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account set cba_account_number = null
 
WHERE cba_account_number_encrypted is not null;

Also make a script to execute in case of some kind of critical failure during release that will revert:

Alter table ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account rename column cba_account_number to cba_account_number_old;
 
Alter table ipaylater_customer.customer_bank_account rename column cba_account_number_backup to cba_account_number;
item.summary: DB - Migration scripts (drop/rename/etc)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [IPL-19142] Bugs and Tasks for Change Payment Method Confirmation Emails
item.description:
Introduction

Small formatting bugs.
Some more tests.

Responsible PO Responsible PM Responsible RM
Stefan Duc -
Description

Please provide PDF Attachments for:

  • fix formatting for 24 month rate plan (see change_payment_method_pm6_pdfattachment_24_month_bug.png)

item.title: [IPL-18964] [OFF-SPRINT] [SEPA DD] Additional check: co_status = 2
item.description:
Introduction
Responsible PO Responsible PM
James -

We currently are debiting orders which have a co_status of 1 (CREATED) — this means that the orders do not yet have associated debts. We will implement a check to ensure that only orders which have a co_status of 2 can be debited.

Acceptance Criteria
  • sub-orders with a co_status other than 2 are never, ever debited
  • there should be a minimal, almost imperceivable change in the amount of debts being debited; if there is a significant change, investigate and bring to PO attention in a timely fashion
Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
   

Example:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=25651581

1. Adjust SP

Adjust ipaylater_debt.fetch_direct_debit_sepa_batch to take co_status into account for both the PM2 and PM3-6 branches and should be done on a sub-order level, as to account for partial activation.

2. Adjust SEPA DD Tests

Adjust all SEPA DD tests (both positive and negative) to account for this additional condition.

TODO
  • adjust procedure
  • test
item.summary: [OFF-SPRINT] [SEPA DD] Additional check: co_status = 2

status.description: Issue is ready for development

item.title: [IPL-18577] [IT-SEC] Encryption customer's bank accounts, Part 3 (Test null + External Apps)
item.description:
Introduction
Responsible PO Responsible PM
James Jan

We have created a secure and seamless way to encrypt customer bank accounts and have implemented it across all appropriate processes. The final part of this encryption implementation deals with dropping the old plain text CBA column.

Breakdown:

Part 1 IPL-17830 Encrypt CBAs, Create Key DB, Create service in commons, Proof-of-concept with ipaylater_debt.fetch_direct_debit_sepa_batch
Part 2 IPL-18576 Extend proven concept to all other components / processes which require plain text CBAs (Billpay apps only)
Part 3 IPL-18577 Drop plain text CBA column, Assess external application needs
Acceptance Criteria
  • BI verified successful decryption of CBAs via MicroStrategy query
  • BI verified reporting to net-m is correct
  • BI verified Selbstauskunft report is correct
  • end-to-end testing complete
    • order to inkasso
    • order to total discharge via BO
    • PM1 order conversion to PL
  • payments page order
  • PMs / POs verified both emails and lettershops
Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Plain text CBAs are still stored in DB No more plain text CBAs stored

This user story is the third step in our CBA encryption implementation. We will remove the plain text CBA column from the DB and then rename the encrypted CBA column to take the name of the dropped plain text column. Additionally, we will create the stand-alone application which a user may use to decrypt encrypted data.

@Jan Wehrs: what is the acceptable reduction in performance for MicroStrategy?

1. Data Warehouse (DWH) interface

  • net-m Monday reports
    @BI: is this created with MicroStrategy or via direct DB interaction?
    • provides all orders including all customer information for orders which net-m owns
    • delivered via SFTP
  • manual "Selbstauskunft" report removed: no CBA currently present in report
    • prepared by BI using MicroStrategy and delivered in PDF form
  • extend service to allow interaction with DWH removed: no current use case
    • While there is a relatively straight forward, DB based implementation which uses Java on the DB side, we do not want to do any encryption/decryption via the DB; as such, the MicroStrategy SDK looks like our best option: https://lw.microstrategy.com/msdz/. Check http://community.microstrategy.com/t5/MicroStrategy-Software/Decrypt-data-from-the-data-warehouse-tables/m-p/215621/highlight/false#messageview_8 for possible solution.

2. Create stand-alone or web application for decryption

  • pass list of strings (role name, password, column request, data); return plain text values

3. Rename encrypted column to normal column

  • cba_{encrypted-prefix}_account_number to cba_account_number
  • cba_{encrypted-prefix}_bank_code to cba_bank_code

4. Global testing

4.1 Jobs

  • Ensure that all of the following jobs continue to function as desired:
    • CSV Batch Import Orders
    • ? Customer Portal - Convert Payment Method
    • DD XML - Process DD transactions
    • Esr - Process invoice for CHE
    • Inkasso - Process contract termination
    • Inkasso - Process open payment debts
    • MT940 *
    • Process Event Queue
    • Process INKASSO *
    • Process Mandate Notifications
    • Process Notifications
    • Send TC Noticication emails
    • Sepa customer reimbursement
    • Update bank list

4.2 Applications

  • API
    • should have been covered by Part 1 (DB writes)
  • Customer Portal / REST Service
    • choose bank account
    • add new bank account
    • convert to PayLater (add new account + choose existing)
  • BO
    • Assign bank account
    • Report false incoming transfer
    • Create accounts

4.3 Communications

  • Product verifies emails
  • Product verifies lettershops
TODO
  • create MicroStrategy test environment with Thomas
  • implement web service
  • create interface for MicroStrategy
  • drop + rename columns
  • create stand-alone application
  • global tests
item.summary: [IT-SEC] Encryption customer's bank accounts, Part 3 (Test null + External Apps)

status.description: Issue is ready for development

item.title: [IPL-19274] [OFF SPRINT] [CP] Change PM Bugs Prio2
item.description:
Bug in conversion cpm Inv->PL.

Userflow in steps:

All Screenshots here are AS-IS-Status
  • Step 1: Option to choose PL cpm1.png
  • Step 2: Choosing a PL plan cpm2.png
  • Step 3: Accepting the plan and make a payment cpm3.png
  • Step 4: Choosing an existing bank account cpm4.png
  • Step 5: Adding a new bank account cpm5.png
  • Step 6: Converting a bank account cpm6.png
  • Step 7: Reviewing converted IBAN cpm7.png
  • Step 8: Reading T&C cpm8.png
  • Step 9: Success or Error

Bug Prio 2

  • In Step 3 is missing a "Cancel" - button. Cancel button closes entire "Extend payment section". See Step3_ShouldBe.png
  • In Step 5 add a text link "Back". Leads you on Step back. So either step 4 (if user has an existing bank account) or step 3 (if user doesn't have an existing bank account).
  • If you click on "I don't know my IBAN", don't show the "Please enter your IBAN"-field. see Step6_ShouldBe.png
  • Add a "Back"-button below "Convert". The cancel button takes you back to enter your IBAN. Step6_ShouldBe.png
  • Change possition of text "Conversions are provided as a courtesy and without guarantee, express or implied." and the convert button. see Step6_ShouldBe.png
  • In Step 3,4,5,6,7 "Cancel" should close entire "Extent time"-section and if user clicks again on "Extend time", he needs to start from scratch.
  • In Step 2 rename "Cancel / Abbrechen" to "Change / Ändern"
  • Allignment and graphic issues
    • Step1_ShouldBe.png
    • Step2_ShouldBe.png
    • Step3_ShouldBe.png
    • Step4_ShouldBe.png
    • Step5_ShouldBe.png
    • Step6_ShouldBe.png
    • Step7_ShouldBe.png
  • In Step 6: Disable and deactivate CTA "Change payment method" as long as local bank account hasn't been converted into IBAN. --> Deactivate it in Step 6, re-activate it again in Step 7
  • If user enters an incorrected IBAN (Error message: Please enter a valid IBAN. / Bitte geben Sie eine gültige IBAN an.) or doesn't enter an IBAN (Error message: Please enter a valid IBAN. / Bitte geben Sie eine gültige IBAN an.) or account holder (Error message: Please enter an account holder. / Bitte geben Sie einen Kontoinhaber an.), display the error message like this: Step5_Error_ShouldBe.png
  • Allow to enter foreign bank accounts. see: Step5_ShouldBe_BIC.png (only for PM conversion – other CBA inputs should maintain their current validations; for non-DE IBANs, customer must also enter BIC) --> The field to enter the BIC should only appear if IBAN doesn't start with DE. For foreign bank accounts, the BIC is mandatory. If user needs to enter, but leaves the field empty or uses a non valid BIC, display error messages like here Step5_Error_ShouldBe.png. Messages: Please enter a valid BIC. / Bitte geben Sie eine gültige BIC.
  • If user clicks on Extend time or cancel in Step 6, and user returns to step 4, don't display the IBAN converter. Only display either step4 (if user has existing bank accounts) or step 5 (if user doesn't have an existing bank account)
  • Fix allignment in giropay - "make a payment"-section AS IS giropay_makepayment.png Should BEmake_payment_giropay.png
  • Allignment in payment plan AS IS ratenplan_as-is.png SHOULD BE rateplan.png
item.summary: [OFF SPRINT] [CP] Change PM Bugs Prio2

status.description: Issue is ready for development

item.title: [IPL-19083] [OFF-SPRINT] [DB] Minimum /maximun value to convert INV-PL
item.description:
Introduction

We want to change the minimun amount we want to allow to convert an INV debt to PayLater.

Responsible PO Responsible PM
Stefan None
Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Sometimes we have an mimimun amount to allow to convert All INV debts which have >=20 Euro can be converted (and other conditions are true as well)

Status Quo: We had a "bug" in the "update portal config" hibernate function (not in the create portal)
We used to have 50 Euro minimum amount when we create the portal but when updating the portal config we overwrite with "0 Euro" copied from INV config.

This is fixed in this ticket IPL-19041.

Create and run update script

TODO: Create update script to update all config entries to 20 Euro (not 50 Euro) for PM 5 & 6.

Column Old value new value Note
mrcp_minimum_order_value_units 5000 or 0 2000 20 Euro
mrcp_order_limit_units ? 1000000 10000 Euro

Important: In IPL-19039 we change to check the current config and not the history config.

Change default value for PM 5 & 6

In IPL-17548 we set default values for min/max amount which want to change now.

table column old value new value PM
ipaylater_merchant.def_configuration_payment dcp_minimum_order_value_units 5000 2000 5&6
ipaylater_merchant.def_configuration_payment dcp_order_limit_units 1000000 1000000 5&6 no change
Acceptance Criteria

We allow conversion for all INV debts which have 20 Euro or more which have a corresponding history entry for 5 and 6 (etc.)

TODO
  • create and run update script
  • Change default value for PM 5 & 6
  • create regression tests
item.summary: [OFF-SPRINT] [DB] Minimum /maximun value to convert INV-PL

status.description: Issue is ready for development
